intro: Canavalia iaoensis, commonly known as the Iao Mountain bean, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a legume characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces elongated pods containing several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
